fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
When a Service Desk request is approved, the following sentence is added to the history of the request:
"Your request was ..... and the status changed to...."

This sentence does not seem to be translated in any language (I tested the German, French and Spanish languages so far).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk request that has an approval step
- Approve the Service Desk request
- Open this request from the customer portal
- Change the language of the customer who is viewing the request from the portal in German, then French, then Spanish

h3. Expected results
This sentence should be translated

h3. Actual results
One sentence is still in English, as shown in the 3 screenshots below:
!RequestApproved_SpanishTranslation.png|thumbnail!  !RequestApproved_GermanTranslation.png|thumbnail!  !RequestApproved_FrenchTranslation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(i) Tested in JSD 3.12.2.
# Navigate to the link below to download the compatible OBR file for the current your JIRA version
-- [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-desk/version-history]
 # After downloaded, change the {{.obr}} filetype to {{.zip}} so it can be extracted.
 # Inside it, there will be another JAR file called _"jira-servicedesk-application-x.x.x.jar"_
 # Change the filetype from JAR to ZIP as well to make it extractable.
 # Find the necessary translation file in which in this case it is _jira-servicedesk-application-3.12.2 > i18n > sd-i18n_de_DE.properties_.
 # Add the following string to the last of the line:
{code:java}
sd.request.approvals.activitystream.approval.transition=Ihre Anfrage war {0} und der Status wurde in {1} ge\u00E4ndert{code}
(i) We used Google Translate for the translation, feel free to change it but do not remove the variable which is the 0 and 1 with its bracket.
 # Save the file.
 # Using the terminal, navigate to the _"jira-servicedesk-application-3.12.2"_ directory
{code:java}cd <path to dir>/jira-servicedesk-application-3.12.2{code}
 # From inside the directory, run the following command:
{code:java}jar cf ../jira-servicedesk-application-3.12.2.jar * {code}
 # The JAR file will be created and upload it through the _JIRA Administration > Add-Ons > Manage Add-ons_

For any existing users that already have German as its language set in the profile, the change might not immediate. Try creating a new user and change the user language to see the effect. Also, try accessing the ticket using another browser or in incognito mode for the testing.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At present, if customer replies to a case and changes the subject - JIRA will ignore the change and continue sending notifications using the original subject line on subsequent updates. This feature request is to enable JIRA Service Desk notifications to include changes to the subject line added by customers in the subsequent notifications sent on issue updates

Consider the following scenario:
1) Customer sends an email to JSD with "New problem" subject line
2) JSD logs a request and sends a notification with "Issue-Key New problem"
3) Customer receives the notification and responds, changing the subject line to "Issue-Key New problem, Our-Issue-Key"
4) JSD receives the update and updates the issue
5) On any further update to the issue, JSD will send notifications with the original subject (i.e. "Issue-Key New problem"), ignoring that customer had modified the subject at step 3

h3. Suggested Solution

This feature request is to enable JIRA to set the notification subject based on what is set by customer in subsequent email replies (i.e. what is set at step 3 above)

h3. Why this is important

It will allow better integrations with external systems

h3. Workaround 

Not available

fields.description:
Make the Service Desk approval process "FDA 21 CFR Part 11" compliant

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Service Desk does not force the approver of a request to login when approving a request either by email or directly from the request, and if the user is already logged in.

To be Part11 compliant, it is necessary that the approver re-enters their credentials to approve the request, *even if they are already logged in*.

Here is some links about the "FDA 21 CFR Part 11" compliant:
https://www.accessdata.fda.gov/scripts/cdrh/cfdocs/cfcfr/CFRSearch.cfm?CFRPart=11
https://www.mastercontrol.com/ppc/21-cfr-part-11/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI2tCBt4D63gIV7R-tBh1sJQBpEAAYASAAEgJw2vD_BwE

h3. Current behavior

There are currently 2 ways for an approver to approve a request:
# By email: by clicking on the *Approve* button from the notification email sent to the approval
!Screenshot1.png|thumbnail!
# From the customer portal: by opening the request from the customer portal, and then clicking on the *Approve* button in the request
!Screenshot4.png|thumbnail!

For either method, the approver *either needs to log into the Customer Portal, or to be already logged into the Portal*:
- _For the method by email:_ when the approver clicks on the *Approve* button:
-- the approver will be redirected to a page inviting them to login to be able to approve *if the approver is not already logged into the Customer Portal*:
!Screenshot2.png|thumbnail!
-- after the approver logs in, or *if the approver was already logged in* before clicking on the button from the email, the following screen will be displayed:
!Screenshot3.png|thumbnail!
- _For the method using the Customer Portal_: the approver will need to first open the request from the Customer Portal (by logging in if they are not already logged in), and then will be able to click on the *Approve* button.

(!) The problem with either method is that is the Approver is already logged in in Service Desk, they will be able to use the "Approve" button (from the email or the customer portal) without being forced to re-enter their credentials.


h3. Suggested Solution

Whenever an approver clicks on the Approver button (from the email or the customer portal), prompt them to re-enter their credentials, even if they are already logged in.

h3. Workaround 

No workaround for users without a license.

Some add-ons provide this type of feature, but they only work from the JIRA UI view, so for users who have application access via a license. Possible add-ons include:
- [Electronic Signature Fields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211601/electronic-signature-fields?hosting=server&tab=overview]
- Add-ons provided by Deviniti and cPrime
fields.summary: Make the Service Desk approval process "FDA 21 CFR Part 11" compliant

In this document https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-agents-customers-and-roles, we wrote the following:
{quote}
*Administrators* have access to project configuration settings. Administrators do not need an agent license, but they will at least need a Jira license. - Manage users and roles in service desk projects
- Set up customer portals, request types, queues, reports and SLAs
- Perform all tasks that agents can
